title: Output of the production industries
summary: Broad industry groups and main industrial groupings.

breadcrumb.title: Home
breadcrumb.summary: The UK's largest independent producer of official statistics and the recognised national statistical institute of the UK.

breadcrumb.title: Business, industry and trade
breadcrumb.summary: Statistics in this area are related to the production and trade of good and services. These statistics are important for users looking to learn more about this section of the UK economy. Key statistics here are figures on retail sales, business activity, indices for the construction and manufacturing industries and international trade.

breadcrumb.title: Manufacturing and production industry
breadcrumb.summary: A range of industries come under the heading 'production', the manufacturing industry is the biggest, but also included are the mining & quarrying, energy supply and water supply & waste management industries. These production industries make up around 14.6% of the UK's total output. The statistics here are widely used in the private and public sector, particularly by the Bank of England, Her Majestyâ€™s Treasury and the Office for Budget Responsibility, to assist and inform policy and decision making.
